docs.snippet: To the Editor:         "Where Countless Died in '81, Horror Lives On in Salvador" (front page, Feb.  12) fails to mention a significant fact. Those soldiers responsible for this massacre of hundreds of unarmed men, women and children at El Mozote,...
docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: "Where Countless Died in '81, Horror Lives On in Salvador" (front page, Feb. 12) fails to mention a significant fact. Those soldiers responsible for this massacre of hundreds of unarmed men, women and children at El Mozote, El Salvador, were trained at the United States Army School of the Americas at Fort Benning, Ga.

docs.snippet: It isn't the jet-black hair, the silky pink dress or her endearing effervescence that win her fans, but at 60 years old, Mariko Mukai is still a siren in Japan. For millions of ordinary Japanese, who for two decades watched American movies on Japa...
docs.lead_paragraph: It isn't the jet-black hair, the silky pink dress or her endearing effervescence that win her fans, but at 60 years old, Mariko Mukai is still a siren in Japan. For millions of ordinary Japanese, who for two decades watched American movies on Japanese television, she is the sweet and syrupy falsetto of Marilyn Monroe. Marilyn Monroe with a high-pitched voice?

docs.snippet: When Ray Allen takes his place with the starting lineup of the University of  Connecticut Huskies, the introduction over the public-address system -- "From Dalzell, South Carolina . . ." -- is as misleading as it is loud.         South Carolina wa...
docs.lead_paragraph: When Ray Allen takes his place with the starting lineup of the University of Connecticut Huskies, the introduction over the public-address system -- "From Dalzell, South Carolina . . ." -- is as misleading as it is loud. South Carolina was the stop just before this one, before Allen grew to become considered the best player in the school's history and perhaps the finest in the nation this season. But long before Dalzell, Allen was a child of the world, the middle of five children in an Air Force family, a circumstance that helps explain the rare navigational skills of the person still taking shape.

headline.main: UConn's Allen Is Worldly And Wise

docs.snippet: Even though "The Postman" last week became the first foreign-language film since the 1973 Swedish drama "Cries and Whispers" to win an Oscar nomination for best picture, relatively few American filmgoers are likely to see this bittersweet Italian ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Even though "The Postman" last week became the first foreign-language film since the 1973 Swedish drama "Cries and Whispers" to win an Oscar nomination for best picture, relatively few American filmgoers are likely to see this bittersweet Italian comedy. Its gross box-office revenues to date are $11 million -- impressive for its genre, but little more than a weekend's work for an above-average Hollywood offering. The problem is simple: "The Postman" is filmed in Italian and subtitled in English, sharply curtailing its appeal for American audiences. And Miramax Films, which distributed the film, has no plans to release a dubbed version.

headline.main: Will Dubbing Fly in the U.S.? Read My Lips

docs.snippet: IT was the place to find Fats Waller and Langston Hughes, Marcus Garvey and Father Divine, W.E.B. Du Bois and several Adam Clayton Powells. It was a center  of cultural ferment, the most famous black community in America.          But Harlem wasn'...
docs.lead_paragraph: IT was the place to find Fats Waller and Langston Hughes, Marcus Garvey and Father Divine, W.E.B. Du Bois and several Adam Clayton Powells. It was a center of cultural ferment, the most famous black community in America. But Harlem wasn't always that. Given its name by Dutch farmers, Harlem had its English, German and Eastern European Jewish incarnations before it became a predominantly black neighborhood early in this century. The transition wasn't altogether easy, as historians point out. In this Black History Month, here are three views of the story.

headline.main: Harlem: Its Origins and Its Struggles

docs.snippet: IN an effort to break down barriers for the uninitiated, Sotheby's and the Bruce Museum in Greenwich have collaborated to present "The Young Collectors Series," three evenings that attempt to make the collecting process less intimidating.         ...
docs.lead_paragraph: IN an effort to break down barriers for the uninitiated, Sotheby's and the Bruce Museum in Greenwich have collaborated to present "The Young Collectors Series," three evenings that attempt to make the collecting process less intimidating. The series, designed to inform and entertain experienced as well as budding collectors of fine and decorative arts, will expose participants to 10 criteria for collecting as well as examine values of objects and provide an idea on where to start and where to buy.

headline.main: What's Good to Collect? The Experts Offer Some Advice

docs.snippet: WHEN THE DUTCH film "Antonia's Line," a gentle story about five generations of women directed by an outspoken feminist, was shown at the Cannes International Film Festival last spring, a gimmick was used to help it stand out among its competitors:...
docs.lead_paragraph: WHEN THE DUTCH film "Antonia's Line," a gentle story about five generations of women directed by an outspoken feminist, was shown at the Cannes International Film Festival last spring, a gimmick was used to help it stand out among its competitors: only women could attend the first screening. The director, Marleen Gorris, was worried that the gimmick would generate resistance along with the attention, but it proved to be a huge success. The first screening was packed, as were subsequent ones. In the end, the film was picked up for distribution in 22 countries.

docs.snippet: JUST WHEN CLASSICAL record labels were searching for material that would yield greater profits than the mainstream repertory yet not seem crassly commercial, what should fall into their laps but the entire film-score business!         This develop...
docs.lead_paragraph: JUST WHEN CLASSICAL record labels were searching for material that would yield greater profits than the mainstream repertory yet not seem crassly commercial, what should fall into their laps but the entire film-score business! This development was a fluke. After the success of "The Big Chill," in 1983, the pop labels that had previously marketed film scores realized that soundtrack albums amounting to glorified collections of rock oldies sold immensely better than orchestral soundtracks. So they happily bequeathed the conventional soundtrack business to their hungrier classical affiliates.

headline.main: Film Scoring is an Art. Repeat, Film Scoring Is an Art.
